title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Thursday 8 June 2017 - BBC News
summary: man abused at two care homes .
man charged in honiton murder probe .
general election 2017 : voting under way across england .
first day of the royal cornwall show .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we will have extensive coverage of the election results with a special live page running through the night from 22:00 , as well as a live programme on bbc radio cornwall and devon .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .

documents.title: royal cornwall show : three little pigs
text: obviously being on show is a bit tiring for these three berkshire pigs .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: royal cornwall show : official charities
text: each year , managers of the royal cornwall show select two charities to benefit from being able to officially fundraise at the three-day event .
this year , the alzheimer 's society and the cornwall air ambulance ( will be making full use of this status .
organisations which have benefited previously include cornwall hos care and age uk .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: royal cornwall show : the cute and furries
text: if you 're a fan of cavies ( guinea pigs , etc ) , there was plenty of cuteness in their tent , including possibly the furriest guinea pig i think i have ever seen .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: 'honey ' trap led to pensioner being fleeced of £ 35,000
text: a pensioner was sent messages with words like `` honey '' to persuade him that he would marry a fictitious asian woman .
geoff hoyland paid £ 20,000 into a bank account to show the family of the fictitious woman that he was of a stable background , truro crown court heard .
judge simon carr said : `` the victim was in his late 60s and as he said in his statement , a very lonely man '' who was `` at an emotional low '' and `` a sitting duck for exploitation '' .
mr hoyland , from oxfordshire had been using facebook to look for love .
jynal khan , of hendra road in st dennis in cornwall , admitted fraud and was jailed for two years .
author: Naomi Kennedy
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: royal cornwall show : how do you get a sheep 's wool quickly ?
text: how do you gets a sheep 's wool quickly ?
shear talent , i 'd say .
boom boom !
this is one of the rounds of the juniors sheep-shearing championship at the show .
they can get a coat off in a matter of minutes .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: zoo 's poison frog world first
text: paignton zoo environmental park has become the first in the world to breed an endangered peruvian frog .
staff have successfully bred the summers ' poison frog in a zoo for the first time .
this species was only described in 2008 , when it was separated from the red headed poison frog and identified as a separate species .
lower vertebrate and invertebrate keeper dr katy upton said : according to the global computer database for zoo records , we are the first collection to successfully breed this species .

`` this may be because of the recent taxonomic change of this species , but we are proud to have the summers ' poison frog here and excited to be able to display this incredible frog to our visitors . ''

documents.title: royal cornwall show : a little history
text: who 'd have thought that a ploughing match would evolve into one of cornwall 's most famous events ?
that 's precisely how the royal cornwall show started well , in its first incarnation .
the cornwall agricultural society , founded in bodmin in 1793 , held its first event in september that year - the aforementioned ploughing match - near the red lion inn in truro .
the following year saw prizes for livestock being added to the awards on offer and things have mushroomed from there .
the society became known as the royal cornwall agricultural association in 1858 .
although based in the then county town of bodmin from 1793 to the mid-1820s , competitions were often also held in various other parts of the county .
it moved to truro from 1827 to 1857 , but the association then `` turned nomadic '' , show historians said , with the annual show being staged in the east and west of cornwall in alternate years .

apart from breaks during world war one and world war two , the show was to be staged on this alternate site basis until 1960 when the royal cornwall showground at wadebridge became its permanent home .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: cornwall 's polling stations
text: polling stations around cornwall are in a range of buildings , including village halls , restaurants and castles .

documents.title: royal cornwall show : goat competition winner is no kidder
text: meet sam and boxo nutlet the goat , winners of the kid category of the goat competition .
there are proud smiles all around .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: fake dating of asian woman led to love-lorn man losing £ 35k
text: a 36-year-old man has been jailed for two years after fleecing a retired man out of £ 35,000 through a fake dating profile .
jynal khan , of hendra road in st dennis in cornwall , admitted fraud .
the victim , geoff hoyland , from oxfordshire had been using facebook to look for love .
truro crown court heard how fake dating photos sent to mr hoyland of an attractive asian woman in her early 30s were used to get the money .
judge simon carr said `` you deliberately manipulated his emotions '' .
author: Naomi Kennedy
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: royal cornwall show : drumming up support for pipers
text: the pipes are calling at @ twitterid # rcs17 # rcs2017
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: weather : further showers overnight
text: clear and dry spells are expected overnight with variable amounts of cloud and further showers - maybe some heavier ones .
moderate or fresh southwesterly winds will turn to the west by morning .
min temp 10c
tomorrow will be a drier and brighter day with spells of sunshine .
a few isolated showers are possible , especially in the morning , with cloud increasing and gradually lowering during the afternoon .
some rain arriving in the far west towards evening .
max temp 19c
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: royal cornwall show : want a closer goosey gander ?
text: i 'm not exactly sure what i said to this goose to make it want to try and get out of its cage , but i promise i apologised and stepped away immediately .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: poldark could be cornwall 's bergerac or heartbeat
text: the poldark effect could continue to bring millions of pounds a year to cornwall as series three begins this weekend .

that 's according to a university of exeter academic who likens the popularity to the 90s hit show heartbeat which brought in nine million pounds to a small area of yorkshire each year it was on air .
businesses in charlestown , where the port acts as the backdrop for truro in the historical drama , say the series has helped the area 's fortunes .
dr joanne connell , the director of tourism at the exeter 's business school , says poldark 's enduring legacy can be likened to that of bergerac .
she said `` that was filmed in the 1980 's and there 's still interest today .
it 's one of the main attractors to jersey .
`` i think that poldark has got a real potential to stay in the hearts and minds of the viewers .
it 's the emotional connection with the characters . ''

documents.title: royal cornwall show : vintage vehicles are lovely jubbly
text: antique cars and trucks , steamrollers and a fairground are featured in the vintage vehicle area of the showground .
but what 's this ?
has someone given only fools and horses ' del boy a permit to get in ?
`` mange tout , rodney .
mange tout , '' as derek trotter would say .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: olejnik signs for mansfield after exeter exit
text: mansfield town have signed bobby olejnik after exeter city decided not to offer the goalkeeper a new contract .
the 30-year-old former peterborough and torquay keeper spent two seasons with the grecians before being released .

the former austria under-21 international , who has also played for scunthorpe and york city , played in both legs of the league two play-off semi-finals last season , but was on the bench for the final as the grecians lost to blackpool at wembley .
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: royal cornwall show : shaun display is far from woolly
text: one of the highlights of this year 's flower show is a huge display based on children 's television favourite shaun the sheep .

the farmer 's house , made of potatoes , sees a few adventures under way involving the sheep who have cauliflower `` wool '' , which , from a slight distance , is as good a substitute as you can get .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: wadebridge horses distressed after having their tails cut by a cruel abuser
text: a cruel abuser has been cutting the tails of horses in the wadebridge area , police say .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: royal cornwall show : a spotlight on the bbc theatre sofa
text: spotlight 's justin leigh and david braine were on radio cornwall earlier .
david white is very keen that everyone shows off the mugs for his show .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: royal cornwall show : this little piggy
text: the is little tamworth piggy did n't go to the market , he went to the royal cornwall show instead .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: lameiras joins plymouth from coventry
text: league one newcomers plymouth argyle have signed portuguese midfielder ruben lameiras following his release by coventry city .
lameiras played 69 times for the sky blues after joining them in july 2015 , scoring seven goals .
the 22-year-old moved to england at the age of 10 to join tottenham 's academy , and signed a professional deal in 2014 .
he left spurs the following year without making a senior appearance and had a short spell playing in sweden .
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: man who failed to get his pet put down banned from keeping dogs
text: a man who failed to get treatment for his injured pet has been banned from keeping dogs for three years .
michael prowse , 52 , of trevean road in penzance pleaded guilty to causing unnecessary suffering to a 13-year-old collie cross called sam .
he had taken the animal to a vet , who identified a tumour on his leg and suggested sam should be put down .
prowse requested time for his family to say goodbye before he died , but he never returned .
sam was found four months later with the mass on his leg still ulcerated .
sam , who was euthanised on welfare grounds , was confirmed to have been suffering throughout the whole period by a vet .
prowse told truro magistrates ' court he could not face losing sam , having lost his wife to cancer in the same year .
he was also given an eight week suspended jail sentence and another dog is being removed from his care .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter handed tough champions cup draw
text: premiership winners exeter chiefs have been drawn alongside leinster , montpellier and glasgow in next season 's european champions cup pool stage .
rob baxter 's side have visited all three clubs before , with the competition starting in october .
chiefs reached the quarter-final stage of the competition in the 2015-16 campaign , but failed to make it out of their group last season .
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: royal cornwall show : breed winner is n't feeling sheepish
text: if you 've ever wondering what a champion texel sheep looks like , well , here you go .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: port businesses predict poldark boost
text: business owners in charlestown near st austell are bracing themselves for even more visitors as the new series of poldark begins on sunday .
the port has been used as the backdrop for truro in all three series , and with several new restaurants opening near the harbour over the last 12 months - it 's now a year round destination .
melissa marquis already runs a pub in port isaac , where doc martin is filmed , and now owns a restaurant and cafe in charlestown .

she said : `` i definitely think poldark has been really good for charlestown as a whole and it 's brought a lot of people down here who are interested in the history of the harbour as well as the boats '' .
author: Naomi Kennedy
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: royal cornwall show : a rest after the display
text: sometimes you have just had to have a good lie-down if you 've been on show .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: royal cornwall show : pick a competition , any competition !
text: competitions are obviously one of the mainstays of the royal cornwall show , and there are a myriad of categories which people can enter .
what do you fancy ?
here are a few choices for you to start pondering in the meantime :
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: man 'grabbed ' five-year-old girl
text: police are looking for a couple they believe attempted to grab a five-year-old girl in a redruth supermarket .
they say it happened in tesco on tolgus hill between 13:55 and 14:20 on saturday .
the family were approached twice by a man and woman in the store who invited her daughter to go with them .
on the second occasion the man grabbed the girl by the wrist and pulled her towards him , police said .
police described the couple as aged between 50 and 60 .
the man was white , of slim build and had short grey hair .
he had an irish accent and was wearing a dark tweed jacket .
the woman was about 5ft 6ins tall , with brown hair and glasses .
she was wearing a green top and blue jeans .

documents.title: royal cornwall show : how do you get a sheep ready for competition ?
text: apparently the process includes a quick brush .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

a few scattered showers will remain which will be locally heavy .
southwesterly winds will be fresh to strong around the coast , but moderate inland .
max temp : 17c .

documents.title: royal cornwall show : the sheep competitions
text: there are so many breeds of sheep i was n't aware of - i do n't even know where to begin , although this tent seems like a good starting point .

it 's busy , though : animals and their owners are moving in and out all the time , going to the judging rings , coming back from the judging rings , with the winners showing off some prizes on their pens .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: albion re-sign irish flanker grace
text: plymouth albion have re-signed irish flanker eoghan grace three years after he left brickfields .
the 29-year-old has previously played for exeter chiefs , ealing and coventry , and will also work to help boost albion 's profile in the community .
`` i ca n't get away from the place i suppose .
we had a good community ; we had a good group bond at the time i was there . ''
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: royal cornwall show : brushing up on cow anatomy ? this painting may help
text: you may be wondering why this cow has been painted on .
well , do n't worry , rosie at the penbode vets ' stand is being used as a living portrait to show where all her organs are .

jonathan , from penbode , said it was part of work to raise awareness of better management of livestock , and that animals can be kept healthier if farmers know where and what size an animal 's organs are .
he said : `` for instance , many people do n't realise how small a cow 's lungs are compared to those rest of them .
that 's why they can get pneumonia easily . ''
rosie also has her own internal difficulties , with a dispatched stomach .
but she 's fine , we 're assured .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: travel : bodmin traffic lights stuck on red
text: travel : bodmin traffic lights stuck on red
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: man abused at two care homes
text: a victim of `` organised and systemic '' abuse at a care home was sent there after being abused at another home .
staff members at two devon care homes for adults with learning disabilities were convicted on wednesday .
ben , 25 , a resident at vielstone , one of the two homes near bideford , had been transferred there after being abused at the winterbourne view home , his family say .
his mother claire garrod said he described being `` kicked , punched , stripped naked , water poured on him '' .
this came after ben , who has autism , `` had his jaw fractured and lost teeth after a nurse punched or kicked him in the face '' while he was at winterbourne view , near bristol , mrs garrod said .
author: Ben Chapple
BBC News Online

documents.title: royal cornwall show : the cattle competition
text: despite the drizzle earlier , the judging of cattle was popular .
i 'm glad the judges know what they 're looking for because i was a little wary of getting too close to such a collection of obviously hefty beasts .
and if you 've ever wondered how they get them so clean before competition , a vacuum cleaner often comes into play .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: vigil for terror victims in falmouth
text: students from both falmouth and exeter universities joined people on the moor in falmouth last night as they held a candlelit vigil to remember the victims of the recent terror attacks in london and manchester .
the event was organised in the wake of saturday night 's attack in the capital .
it was designed to show solidarity with the families of the victims whilst also standing against all forms of extremism in society .
author: Dick Straughan
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: doing the rounds
text: visiting some of the more rural # polling stations in central devon consistency .
had a very positive reception from election staff # coffee .
reassurance visit to # leusden polling station on # dartmoor .
very wet/windy/misty .
isolated location but good turnout so far .
@ dc police

documents.title: ainslie made to wait as america 's cup delayed
text: there was frustration for cornwall 's sir ben ainslie as yesterday 's semi-final races at the america 's cup in bermuda were postponed because of high winds .
new zealand lead ainslie 's great britain team 3-1 in their first-to-five contest .
in the other semi-final , japan lead sweden 3-1 .
america 's cup race management said all four scheduled races will now move to today , when better conditions are forecast .
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: royal cornwall show : good day , sunshine
text: what 's that in the sky ?
the sun trying to break through the clouds .
some sunny intervals are forecast for the rest of the day .
we 'll have more weather updates during the afternoon .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: fake tanned sheep ?
text: these sheep at the royal cornwall show are not naturally this colour .
they 've been dyed to better show off their faces and legs for the judges .
nicki prowse explained : `` we spray them up just to make them show their heads off better and their legs .
it just gives their bodies a bit more shape . ''
the orange texels that caught pam and my attention in the sheep section @ twitterid # rcs2017
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: ringo returns home after five years
text: ringo the cat has been reunited with his owners in devon , five years after they last saw him .
the daniels family in bradninch say they were 'stunned ' to receive the call saying he had been found .
the ginger puss went missing during the london olym in 2012 .

carolyn daniels said she received a phone call from a local feline charity saying ringo had returned : `` i had to go to work and on my way home i went to collect him and until i saw him i just could n't believe it .
`` when i got home i told the girls and they were stunned ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: royal cornwall show : the raf falcons plan to drop in
text: it 's not just events on the ground that should hold the crowd 's interest .
the raf falcons parachute display team is returning once again to wow crowds , jumping into the showground 's main ring .
they are due to drop in at :
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: war begins on the invasive menace taking over dartmoor
text: from the car window a hillside full of bracken might look quite attractive .
yet it is a menace for agriculture and wildlife .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: have you seen paul whatley ?
text: police are trying to find missing man paul whatley from exeter .
he was last seen at his home address on topsham road at about 03:00 on tuesday .
mr whatley is described as a white , 53-years-old , of slim build , 5 ' 9 '' tall , and is thought to be wearing a navy blue jacket , blue tracksuit bottoms and trainers .
he is believed to be in the dawlish/exeter area .

documents.title: cats patrolling polling station
text: meeting the locals on our election day patrols # generalelection17 # camborne

documents.title: royal cornwall show : association is well-grounded
text: the royal cornwall agricultural association , which runs the show , is not short of a scrap of land if it needs it for whatever purposes .
it owns more then 200 acres of land and rents or leases approximately a further 30 acres , bosses say .

of those multitudes of acres , the showground itself covers some 95 acres : enough for its main ring , huge areas for agricultural machinery and related displays , hundreds of livestock and other competitions and more than 1,000 trade stands .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: man accused of murder appears in court
text: a 54-year-old man has appeared in court charged with the murder of a man at the kingdom hall of jehovah 's witnesses in honiton , devon .
keith beviss , of woodhayes drive , honiton , appeared at exeter magistrates ' court and was remanded in custody .
philip ryan , 55 , a married electrician , was found with stab wounds inside the hall in the east devon town on tuesday afternoon .

documents.title: royal cornwall show : even the sheep are staying out of the rain
text: there have been vague glimmers of brighter weather as the morning has gone on , but the odd shower has resulted in an occasional dive for cover .
these swiss mountain sheep , however , have it easy - with their natty gazebo , but still able to be close to their admirers .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: man 'trapped between two walls ' rescued
text: a man trapped between two walls has been rescued by firefighters , devon and somerset fire and rescue service has said .
the man fell into a narrow gap in factory row , torquay and was unable to free himself , the service added .
firefighters used small tools and a short ladder to free the man .
ambulance crews treated him at the scene .

documents.title: flybe : too many planes in a crowded marketplace
text: the weakening pound has worsened flybe 's problems , pushing the exeter-based airline 's annual losses to £ 20m .
flybe found itself with too many planes in a crowded marketplace at a time of slowing consumer demand .
the loss announced today was in line with expectations and shares rose 5 % in early trading .
flybe employs about 800 staff in exeter and one bright spot was the performance of their engineering base there , which saw revenue rise of 17 % .
author: Neil Gallacher, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: royal cornwall show : weatherman kevin meets admirers
text: he may be doing the forecasting for the show , but bbc local radio weatherman kevin thomas is also taking the time to meet his admirers .
`` i saw you taking that ! ''
he told me afterwards .
i obviously need to work on my covert photography skills !
you can also meet many of bbc radio cornwall 's other presenters in the bbc tent .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: royal cornwall show : 'a showcase which offers a fascinating glimpse into the county '
text: the royal cornwall show has been a major showcase since 1793 and offers `` a fascinating glimpse into rural life in the county '' , tourism bosses say .

visit cornwall said that it was amazing how , for three days each year , the wadebridge showground was `` transformed into a living town , bustling with life , energy , agriculture , entertainment and trade '' .
`` it is a significant event on the cornish calendar with around 130,000 people attending , '' it added .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: flybe statement after losses announced
text: exeter-based airline flybe has hit turbulence , running up a near £ 20m loss after previous expansion plans proved too ambitious .

despite the substantial progress in reducing the size of legacy fleet orders in 2015/16 , flybe has still seen significant capacity growth in a market where we witnessed slower growth in consumer demand .
new routes and increased frequencies were targeted to cover marginal costs in the early years of operation , but do not contribute significantly to overall profitability .
the capacity growth therefore had a negative effect on profitability .
we will make flybe a sustainable business that operates the best routes and at the best times to suit the needs of our customers .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: royal cornwall show : food tent proves popular during showers
text: the weather has started to brighten a little , but the relative warmth of one of the food tents is still proving tempting to many .
however , that might also be down to the selection of tasty-looking comestibles on offer .
these two terriers certainly liked being beside one of the pasty stands .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: race to vote is on in scilly
text: polling station across the uk opened at 07:00 , and will remain open until 22:00 .
the most southerly stations in the country are in the isles of scilly , and this family raced to be first in the queue at bryher community centre this morning .
issy tibbs said : `` there was actually a race to be first to vote .
a 90-year-old man ran to beat mum ! ''

documents.title: royal cornwall show : the david white show is live
text: we 're broadcasting live from the royal cornwall show throughout its three days .
david white is enjoying his cup of tea as it 's still a little cold in the tent .
however , that will warm up as more people come in to visit , so pop along .
he 's on until noon , and his sofa is ready for guests .
who will they be ?
you 'll have to listen in to hear or better , come in and see .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: flybe promises overhaul after £ 20m loss
text: regional airline flybe has hit turbulence , running up a near £ 20m loss after previous expansion plans proved too ambitious .
the carrier reported a pre-tax loss of £ 19.9m in the year to 31 march , despite revenues rising 13.4 % to £ 707.4m .
flybe said it would start to reduce the size of its fleet after it saw slowing growth in consumer demand .
however , it insisted the current year was going well and efforts to turn a profit again were well underway .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: royal cornwall show : the early birds
text: the rain may have been a bit heavier earlier , but that has not deterred those keen to get in the show 's gates early .
however , there have been queues to get into the show 's car parks for a while and some areas are a bit muddy , so when you arrive , be careful .
we 'll have more traffic reports through the day .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: travel : slow moving to royal cornwall show
text: travel : slow moving to royal cornwall show
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: flybe losses : 'slow consumer demand and weak pound '
text: slowing consumer demand and the weakening of the pound have helped cause more problems for flybe .
the airline has announced a pre-tax loss of £ 6.7m .
when losses on us dollar loan revaluations are taken into account , the overall loss is £ 20m .
the exeter-based airline says the result is in line with expectations .
flybe 's shares were up 5 % in early trading .
author: Neil Gallacher, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: latest travel : heavy traffic approaching royal cornwall show
text: latest travel : heavy traffic approaching royal cornwall show
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: send us your of polling stations
text: are you on your way to vote ?
we 'd love to see your from polling stations around devon and cornwall .
whether you 're casting your vote at a school , a community centre or somewhere a bit different , it would be great to have a selection sent through .
you 're 'strongly advised ' not to take photos inside , but outside is allowed and we 'd especially like to see any cats or other animals you may come across !
email us your best snaps .

documents.title: royal cornwall show : poultry and bird displays and competitions going ahead
text: the poultry section is going ahead at this year 's royal cornwall show after previous concerns that it would be cancelled because of bird movement restrictions to prevent bird flu from spreading .

the restrictions were imposed by the department for environment , food & rural affairs restrictions on poultry and captive birds across the country in december 2016 after an outbreak of avian influenza .
it was confirmed in april that they were being lifted .
the popular poultry section at wadebridge includes a national level egg competition .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: missing callington man jason bond thought to be wearing tesco uniform
text: concern is growing for the welfare of a missing man 46-year-old man from callington .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: man charged with honiton jehovah 's witnesses hall murder
text: devon and cornwall police say a 54-year-old man from honiton has been charged with the murder of a man in the town .
the body of philip ryan , 55 , was found at the kingdom hall of jehovah 's witnesses in dowell street on tuesday .
the charged man is due to appear at exeter magistrates ' court this morning .
mr ryan 's family have paid tribute , saying : `` philip was a very kind , gentle and loving husband who will be greatly missed by all his family and friends .
we are in a state of shock .
there are n't any words to describe our pain . ''
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: flybe hits turbulence
text: flybe has posted a loss for 2016 after struggling with slower customer demand and rising costs .
total revenue climbed 13.4 % for the year ended 31 march to £ 707.4m , but its pre-tax loss was £ 19.9m after a £ 2.7m profit last year .
the firm blamed competitive market conditions along with a writedown related to upgrading its it systems .
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: advice for those whose ballot papers are missing in plymouth
text: as people go to the polls in the general election , there 's advice for anyone caught up in the missing postal votes problem .
more than 1,500 people did n't receive their postal ballot papers in the plymouth area .
plymouth city council 's blaming computer problems and has apologised .
it says anyone who still has n't received their postal ballot papers can up new ones from the council house until 17:00 and vote on the spot .
you can also take your postal ballot to a polling station and vote that way .
for those who are without their ballots and away from the uk , they will not be able to vote .
unfortunately emergency proxy votes for people who are abroad are not allowed in these circumstances . ''
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: breakingman charged in honiton murder probe
text: police say a man has been charged with the murder of philip ryan , who was found dead in a jehovah 's witness hall in honiton on tuesday .
more to come .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: royal cornwall show : the beeb will be there as well
text: fancy meeting some of your favourite presenters from bbc radio cornwall and bbc spotlight ?
the all-new bbc radio cornwall theatre will see david white broadcasting his morning show on thursday and friday between 9:00 and 12:00 .
spotlight have also a full programme from the show on thursday and a reporter there on friday .
presenter victoria graham will also be in the marquee on saturday .
fancy a studio selfie ?
want to see a bit of what goes on behind the scene when we broadcast ?
we can show you some of that and will be happy to answer all your questions .
there will also be plenty of other entertainment , including acts who have featured on bbc introducing through all three days of the show , and our own bbc radio cornwall band ( on saturday .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: weather : heavy bursts of rain
text: it 's a damp and cloudy start to the day with outbreaks of rain and drizzle , some of which will be heavy for a time .
however , during the afternoon it 'll become brighter with the cloud lifting to give some sunny spells as well as a few scattered , but locally heavy showers .
southwesterly winds will be fresh to strong around the coast , but moderate at times inland .
max temp : 17c
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: voting is under way in general election
text: thousands of people across devon and cornwall will cast their votes today in the general election .
polling stations opened at 07:00 , and will close at 22:00 .
nationally , the first results will come before midnight , with the vast majority of constituencies declaring in the early hours of tomorrow morning .
we will have extensive coverage of the election results with a special live page running through the night , as well as a live programme on bbc radio cornwall and devon .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: royal cornwall show : a soggy drive
text: well , it 's a bit of a soggy start on the way to wadebridge for the show .
but me and my colleagues are not letting that dampen our spirits as we make our way up from truro .
we 'll also have weather forecasts through the day to let you know what it 's like there .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: flybe announces a pre-tax loss of £ 6.7m
text: the exeter-based airline says the result is in line with expectations .
most of the loss is down to the airline 's struggle with its it costs as it builds what it calls `` a sustainable platform for future business '' .
author: Neil Gallacher, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: royal cornwall show : live reporting from wadebridge
text: morning .
i 'll be at the show for the first day , bringing you the sights and sounds as the show carries on in its 223rd year .
as well as showing what 's happening through the day , we 'll also have a few features talking about the history of the show , and what it means to people and organisations in the county
if you see me about , please feel free to come and say hello .
and if there 's anything you think i should know about , you can email me here .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live
